# Using the package

## Installation

To get the current development version from Github using R, use the
[*devtools*](http://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/devtools/index.html) package:

```r
if (!require("devtools'")) install.packages("devtools")
devtools::install_github("KevCaz/recruitR")
library(recruitR)
```


## Examples

### Using a kernel

A simple call to one on the kernel:

```{r}
kern_gaussian(4, 3)
```

Simple plots:

1. Gaussian kernel:

```{r,  fig.width=6,  fig.height=6}
seqx <- seq(0,10,0.001)
plot(seqx, kern_gaussian(seqx, .5), type='l')
```

2. Log_normal kernel:
```{r,  fig.width=6,  fig.height=6}
plot(seqx, kern_lognormal(seqx, 3, .2), type='l')
```

3. Exponential_powerl kernel:
```{r,  fig.width=6,  fig.height=6}
plot(seqx, kern_exponential_power(seqx,2,3), type='l')
```
